Projects

Joseph Hyatt

I'm currently developing a Discussion Board Application for the Flatiron School. I have a blog where I discuss challenges I run into and how I was able to overcome those challenges. I'm constantly adding to my wiki where I share the resources I find useful on a variety of subjects.


My current and past projects include:

Discussion Board

Discussion Board is an open source website I'm creating for The Flatiron School. I'm using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, jQuery, and Bulma to create this project.

  • Using a has_many :through relationship to create a join table that allows a user to find a discussion and discussion to find a user. A has_many :through relationship makes everything available, such as categories, or in this case discussions.
  • Gravatar_image_tag - Shows a users gravatar image if they're signed in.
  • Rolify and Cancancan - Helps with an admins user role by hooking into devise to make the admin user role.
  • Friendly_id - Helps create slugs (a slug is a name given to a URL of a page) for our URL's, and is responsible for making the URL an actual slug rather than numbers. Makes it easier to remember and when you share it with someone.
  • Bulma - A simple, elegant, and modern CSS framework that has a different feel to it than Bootstrap.

Dev Hire

Dev Hire is a website I created for my portfolio site as a way for a client to setup an appointment with me to collaborate over some code, or to hire me for some freelance work. I'm using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, and Tailwind CSS to create this project.

  • Stripe - To make or receive payments over the internet.
  • Foreman - Allows a user to use multiple procfiles in a Ruby on Rails application. Foreman will startup Redis, Sidekiq, and the Rails Server for you.
  • Tailwind CSS - A CSS framework which is different from frameworks such as Bootstrap which give the site a different feel.
  • Webpacker - Helps manage app like JavaScript modules in Ruby on Rails.

Tasky

I love to make things that may help others.

Tasky is a project managing tool that organizes your projects into boards to keep you on track. Tasky was built with Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap. Main features of Tasky include:

  • Devise - Manages user authentication.
  • Omniauth - Allowing users to login/signup using their Facebook account.
  • Bootstrap - For developing responsive, mobile-first projects.
  • Redcarpet - A fast, safe and extensible Markdown to (X)HTML parser.
  • Particle.js - A lightweight JavaScript library for creating particles.
  • Friendly_id - The "Swiss Army bulldozer" of slugging and permalink plugins for Active Record. It lets you create pretty URLs and work with human-friendly strings as if they were numeric id's.
  • Font Awesome Icons - Popular icon set and toolkit.
  • Custom Error Messages - Gives the ability to have custom validation error messages prefixed with the attribute name.

Travel Site

I built a travel site for a travel company, and this is the template.

  • Using Node.js, Gulp, and npm to help with automating tasks.
  • Mobile First - Users won't have to download any extra data they don't require to view the site.
  • Lazysizes - Lazy loads images (including responsive images (picture/srcset)), iframes and scripts.
  • B.E.M - Block Element Modifier that helps you to achieve reusable components and code sharing in the front-end.

Rails Portfolio

This is a past Portfolio of mine built using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap. I added a video background, full syntax highlighting, and font awesome icons. Being my previous portfolio I have uploaded it to Heroku.

  • License Up - Create a license quickly for a given name.
  • Devise - Manages user authentication.
  • Bootstrap - For developing responsive, mobile-first projects.
  • Markdown Syntax - A plain text formatting syntax aimed at making writing for the internet easier.

BeerMe

A command line interface application that scrapes data from Beer Advocate’s Top 250 Beers List and prints out the top 10 beers to the console.

  • Users may select a beer by inputting the number on the list to find out more details.
  • Beer details include a beer origin, beer styles, alcohol percentage, best seasons to drink selected beer.
  • Results present each beer in a list, along with the corresponding information about chosen beer.

Computer Science

I'm a college student working towards a Bachelor's in Computer Science. I'm currently working with C++, and upload my past assignments to github once it's complete and has received feedback from my professor. I also plan on writing a Blog about my progression, stay tuned.

iki Page

The internet is a big place with an endless amount of information to sift through. I created wiki.josephhyatt.com to keep resources that I found to be useful in a organized area that I can use to reference from time to time. It's an ongoing process that gets updated almost daily. Feel free contribute to it.
